Class MyDate

java.lang.Object
MyDate
public class MyDate extends Object
The MyDate class represents a simplified calendar date with basic functionality such as setting and validating dates, duplicating dates, calculating the next day, and comparing dates.

This class uses Gregorian calendar rules and accounts for leap years. The default date is January 1, 1900. The class provides both instance and static methods to manipulate and retrieve information about dates.

Note: This implementation does not support dates before year 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyDate

      public MyDate()
      Constructs a MyDate object representing the default date: January 1, 1900.

    • MyDate

      public MyDate(int m, int d, int y)
      Constructs a MyDate object with the specified month, day, and year. Invalid values will be corrected to default valid values.
      Parameters:
      m - the month (1–12)
      d - the day (1–31, depending on month and year)
      y - the year (must be non-negative)

  • Method Details

    • setMonth

      public void setMonth(int m)
      Sets the month. Values outside 1–12 will default to 1.
      Parameters:
      m - the month to set

    • setDay

      public void setDay(int d)
      Sets the day. Values outside valid range for the current month and year will default to 1.
      Parameters:
      d - the day to set

    • setYear

      public void setYear(int y)
      Sets the year. Negative values will default to 0.
      Parameters:
      y - the year to set

    • duplicate

      public MyDate duplicate()
      Returns a deep copy of this MyDate object.
      Returns:
      a new MyDate with the same values

    • goToNextDay

      public void goToNextDay()
      Advances this date by one day, modifying the current object.

    • getNextDay

      public MyDate getNextDay(int n)
      Returns a new MyDate that is n days after this date.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of days to advance
      Returns:
      a new MyDate n days later

    • getNextDay

      public MyDate getNextDay()
      Returns a new MyDate that is one day after this date.
      Returns:
      a new MyDate for the next day

    • equals

      public boolean equals(MyDate other)
      Compares this date with another for equality.
      Parameters:
      other - the date to compare with
      Returns:
      true if the dates are equal; false otherwise

    • getDifference

      public int getDifference(MyDate other)
      Calculates the difference in days between this date and another.
      Parameters:
      other - the date to compare with
      Returns:
      a positive value if this date is after other, negative if before, and zero if equal

      public static int getMaxDays(int y, int m)
      Returns the number of days in the specified month and year, accounting for leap years.
      Parameters:
      y - the year
      m - the month
      Returns:
      the maximum number of days in that month

    • isLeapYear

      public static boolean isLeapYear(int y)
      Determines whether the specified year is a leap year.
      Parameters:
      y - the year
      Returns:
      true if the year is a leap year; false otherwise

    • getDaysSinceStart

      public static int getDaysSinceStart(MyDate date)
      Calculates the number of days from January 1, year 0 to the given date.
      Parameters:
      date - the date to compute the day count for
      Returns:
      the total number of days since year 0
